info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 06 at 7:09PM CDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Blount and southern Sevier Counties through 900 PM EDT... At 809 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 10 miles southwest of Pigeon Forge, or 12 miles west of Gatlinburg, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Sevierville, Gatlinburg, Pigeon Forge, Smoky Mountains-Newfound Gap, Pittman Center, Townsend, Wears Valley, Elkmont, Roundtop Mountain State Park and Great Smoky Mountains National Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for east Tennessee.
